panels.name: _documentation / page-section-header

panels.name: Frame 908
text_labels: This method uses background-blend-mode: overlay; to produce desired result. It takes simple gradient and mixes it with underlaying background-color

panels.name: Frame 909
text_labels: There is a difference on how both Figma and browsers are dealing with transparency.

panels.name: Frame 907
text_labels: In Figma there is a difference whether you choose to have transparent white or transparent black.
Browser, however, always treats transparent colour the same way regardless of RGB values you choose

panels.name: Frame 910
text_labels: This method uses two colours that blend together. Top colour could be made as a gradients that goes from 100% to 0% opacity

panels.name: _documentation / page-title
text_labels: The accent palette brings life and meaning to your product. The colour spots can guide user attention, emphasise brand connection or communicate a system state. There are ten accents to work with.

panels.name: Shade 400 is the base colour for bright colour spots. Use it for buttons, call to actions, and selected states.
text_labels: Shade 400 is the base colour for bright colour spots. Use it for buttons, call to actions, and selected states.

panels.name: Shade 100 is semi-transparent subtle accent colour. It blends nicely with anything that sit underneath and can be used for tints and highlights.
text_labels: Shade 100 is semi-transparent subtle accent colour. It blends nicely with anything that sit underneath and can be used for tints and highlights.

panels.name: Shades 600 and 500 are made for text. Shade 600 is for text on dark backgrounds and shade 500 for light backgrounds.
text_labels: Shades 600 and 500 are made for text. Shade 600 is for text on dark backgrounds and shade 500 for light backgrounds.

panels.name: Shade 500 is for for high contrast distinct borders. Shade 300 is for normal border.
text_labels: Shade 500 is for for high contrast distinct borders. Shade 300 is for normal border.

panels.name: Shade 200 for light borders and separators
text_labels: Shade 200 for light borders and separators

panels.name: Shade 300 can be used for non-text elements like glyphs or data visualisation.
text_labels: Shade 300 can be used for non-text elements like glyphs or data visualisation.
